name: Islamic Center of Irvine
mission: Mission statement - To establish a comprehensive center promoting Islamic values and reflecting excellence in serving the needs of the community
zakatClaimEvidence: 100% of the Islamic Center Of Irvine's Zakat fund goes towards providing zakat eligible members in the community. If you would like to contribute funds to help needy families you can do so by either donating your Zakat ul-Maal or your Sadaqah. (Source: https://icoi.net/donate)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Good donor alignment with manageable risk. Evidence quality is solid but still evolving in places.

components.evidence: Explicit zakat program (+4); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Islamic identity (+1)
components.improvement_suggestion: Clarify zakat allocation policy and eligible use categories for donors.
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

alignment.rationale: Alignment 21/50: MEDIUM Muslim donor fit, religious cultural cause area

components.evidence: No beneficiary data available for cost-per-beneficiary scoring; high program ratio (≥85%) suggests efficient delivery
components.improvement_suggestion: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: If reserves are above policy target, document why and publish triggers for planned deployment.
components.name: Financial Health

components.improvement_suggestion: Document a clear theory of change with an explicit causal pathway.
components.name: Theory of Change

risks.description: No outcome measurement or metrics tracking

score_details.score_summary: Islamic Center of Irvine Inc shows strong impact and moderate alignment, with zakat compliance (minor risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: 100% of the Islamic Center Of Irvine's Zakat fund goes towards providing zakat eligible members in the community. If you would like to contribute funds to help needy families you can do so by either donating your Zakat ul-Maal or your Sadaqah. (Source: https://icoi.net/donate)

all_citations.claim: The organization serves the needs of the community through Islamic values and maintains specific financial metadata.
The charity reported total revenue of $2,209,994, a program expense ratio of 89.9%, working capital of 26.3 months, and fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised.
The organization provides various donation options and is identified as zakat-eligible.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a moderate overall score due to its excellent financial efficiency and strong liquidity, balanced against a need for more robust external data verification. Its high directness in capacity building is a significant asset for community stability.
areas_for_improvement: Enhancing data transparency to improve overall third-party evaluation scores.
Increasing public documentation regarding specific long-term impact metrics for its core programs.

dimension_explanations.alignment: ICOI shows medium alignment for Muslim donors as a ZAKAT-ELIGIBLE institution providing essential religious and cultural services [3]. The cause urgency is categorized as religious and cultural, reflecting a steady track record of serving the Irvine community's spiritual needs [1].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates high financial health with a program expense ratio of 89.9% and 26.3 months of working capital, which supports its capacity-building mission [1][2]. While it effectively maintains operations with zero fundraising costs, more third-party evidence is needed to fully validate the long-term outcomes of its social programs [2].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Islamic Center of Irvine Inc serves as a comprehensive community hub dedicated to promoting Islamic values and excellence in service.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 89.9%, indicating the vast majority of funds go directly to community services.
Strong liquidity position with 26.3 months of working capital available.
Exceptional fundraising efficiency with a cost of $0.00 per $1 raised.
baseline_narrative.summary: The Islamic Center of Irvine Inc (ICOI) operates as a religious and community center with a mission to serve the diverse needs of its constituents through spiritual and social programming [1]. In the 2022 fiscal year, the organization reported a total revenue of $2,209,994 while maintaining a high program expense ratio of 89.9% [2]. The center facilitates various community initiatives, including 'The Village In Irvine' and 'ICOI Young Professionals,' and accepts zakat-eligible contributions through its online platform [3].

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a moderate overall score due to its excellent financial efficiency and strong liquidity, balanced against a need for more robust external data verification. Its high directness in capacity building is a significant asset for community stability.

areas_for_improvement.context: The organization currently lacks public beneficiary counts, making it difficult to assess cost-per-beneficiary metrics.
Documenting a clear theory of change with an explicit causal pathway would strengthen impact measurement.

bbb_assessment.summary: BBB assessment data is not available for this organization.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization maintains strong financial health and governance to offset these data gaps.
risk_factors: Missing beneficiary data prevents cost-effectiveness analysis
Lack of a documented theory of change
case_against.summary: The primary limitations relate to data transparency and impact measurement.

confidence.notes: Financial data is solid, but impact metrics are lacking.

alignment.improvement: Clarify zakat allocation policy and eligible use categories for donors.

credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility further, the charity could publish audited financial statements on its website.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for local Orange County donors who want to support a comprehensive Islamic community center and fulfill their zakat obligations locally.
donor_motivations: Want to support local Islamic infrastructure
Seek to fulfill zakat obligations within their community
Value organizations with strong financial health and low fundraising costs
giving_considerations: Impact is localized to the Irvine/Orange County area
Limited data on specific program outcomes or cost-per-beneficiary
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking international humanitarian relief or those who require rigorous academic evidence of effectiveness.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C indicates basic financial reporting is available, but rigorous outcome measurement or beneficiary tracking is missing.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: The organization focuses on capacity building and community service delivery.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence helps ensure donations create real, measurable impact in the community.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: The center has strong reserves but can utilize funds to expand local programming.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by its comprehensive programming and strong liquidity position.

strengths.detail: The organization directs a significant portion of its funding to its mission, with a <cite id="2">program expense ratio of 89.9%</cite>.
ICOI is highly effective at raising funds, operating with a cost of <cite id="1">$0.00 per $1 raised</cite>.
The center maintains robust financial health with <cite id="1">26.3 months of working capital</cite> held in working capital.

strengths_deep_dive: The Islamic Center of Irvine demonstrates robust financial management and community focus. With <cite id="2">$2,209,994 in total revenue</cite>, the center effectively channels resources into its core programs, evidenced by its <cite id="2">program expense ratio of 89.9%</cite>. Furthermore, its fundraising operations are exceptionally lean, requiring <cite id="1">$0.00 per $1 raised</cite>. The organization also maintains a strong governance structure with <cite id="1">100% independent board members</cite>.
rich_narrative.summary: The Islamic Center of Irvine Inc (ICOI) serves as a comprehensive community hub dedicated to promoting Islamic values and excellence in service. In the 2022 fiscal year, the organization reported <cite id="2">$2,209,994 in total revenue</cite>. The center demonstrates strong financial efficiency, maintaining a <cite id="2">program expense ratio of 89.9%</cite>, ensuring the vast majority of funds support community services. ICOI operates with exceptional fundraising efficiency, costing <cite id="1">$0.00 per $1 raised</cite>. The organization provides various community programs, including The Village In Irvine and ICOI Young Professionals, and accepts <cite id="3">zakat-eligible contributions</cite> to support categories such as fuqara and masakin. The center maintains a strong liquidity position with <cite id="1">26.3 months of working capital</cite> in working capital.
